thinking: On turn 0, my priority is to start both resource gathering and worker production. My base at (2,1) will train a new worker to increase our economy and potential attacking force. The existing worker at (1,1) will immediately begin harvesting resources from the closest node at (0,0) and bring them back to the base at (2,1). This will ensure a steady income of resources for future unit training and actions, following the strategy of 'after getting one worker start harvesting' and 'produse all workers do not wait for the other oppone'.

My strategy is to prioritize resource gathering and worker production. I will train a worker from my base to increase my economy. The existing worker will be commanded to continuously harvest resources from the closest node and return them to the base. This ensures a steady income for future unit production and expansion.

My strategy is to continuously produce workers from my base. My first worker will be dedicated to harvesting resources from the nearest node (0,0) and returning them to my base at (2,1) to sustain worker production. Once I have multiple workers, I will send them to attack the enemy base at (5, 6).

The primary goal is to produce as many workers as possible and send them to harvest to gather resources. My base will continuously train workers. The single existing worker will be assigned to harvest resources from the closest node and bring them back to the base. Once more workers are available, they will be sent to attack the enemy base at (5,6) as an 'all-in' strategy, but for now, resource gathering is key to scaling.

My base at (2,1) will continue to train workers to build up my economy and army size, as per the strategy to continuously produce workers. My worker at (1,1) is currently moving towards the resource node at (0,0). I will assign it to harvest from (0,0) and deliver to my base at (2,1) to gather resources. This adheres to the instruction that the first worker should focus on harvesting.

My strategy is to continuously produce workers from the base to boost the economy and prepare for an all-out attack. The existing worker will immediately start harvesting resources to support this production. Once enough workers are trained, they will be sent to attack the enemy base at (5, 6).
